flavorText: While not as large as the T-Rex, the Allosaurus is still very deadly as they are known to travel in packs to survive.
extendedEffectDescription: On Hit, the target creature takes 10 bleed damage. This damage over time effect occurs after the combat step has concluded for the turn this effect was applied. Damage over time effects are flat damage and receive no bonuses. This effect is continuous as long as this card is on the field. After the initial damage that occurs on hit, the effect of the Damage Over Time occurs once per turn cycle after the conclusion of the combat step.

flavorText: Although not the best combat artist, the Assassin is a master of stealth and deadly sneak attacks.
extendedEffectDescription: If the Assassin hits first during a battle step then the total damage, after all dice rolls plus modifiers is calculated, is tripled. Multipliers are the last thing applied to the addition and multiplication equation for calculating damage. Additional multipliers can be applied to this card and added at the end of the equation.

flavorText: N/A
extendedEffectDescription: During your turn, this card allows a target creature on your side of the field to have the following effects: Attack first during battle, Automatically Hit regardless of the result of the Hit Dice Roll, and apply a 3x Damage multiplier at the end of your damage calculations (multiple backstabs or any other creature/magic cards that add a damage multiplier would be multiplied together, use PEMDAS to calculate the overall damage. Example: 3 Backstab’s 3*3*3=27x damage multiplier). This card's ability to automatically Hit would supersede the creature effect of scarlet or other hit reducing cards such as ring of extremes.

flavorText: N/A
extendedEffectDescription: When your opponent casts a magic card, negate the card effect and send it to the cemetery. This card stops the activation of another magic card and therefore the attempted to be played magic card never has its effect activated and will go to the cemetery. Example: Heroism magic card is immune to magic cards. However, due to Blade in the Dark negating the magic card before its effect can occur, Blade in the Dark would destroy the Heroism magic card and send it to the cemetery.

flavorText: While not as powerful as the red dragons, blue dragons are cunning beasts of the winter frost.
extendedEffectDescription: On hit, roll 1 die. If 4-6, your target is frozen for one turn cycle and cannot battle or be sacrificed. If a creature is frozen during a battle and the frozen creature goes second they cannot rebuttal during that battle. A frozen creature may be killed and another creature can be summoned. However, the frozen creature cannot be used as sacrifice material for the newly summoned creature.

flavorText: Once a knight of The Light. These wicked beings have fallen to a darker path on the road to justice.They do not see themselves as evil.
extendedEffectDescription: During the player who controls this card's turn this creature may summon 1 undead creature back to the field from the card owner's cemetery as a limited summoned creature. This card may only control 1 summoned undead on the field at a time. If this effect is nullified in any way, or this card leaves the field for any reason, send the summoned undead creature back to the cemetery. Summoned creatures may be sent back to the owner's hand through various card effects such as Wrath of the Old ones. Summoned undead do not change ownership along with Dark Knight if Dark Knight changes ownership through various card effects.
